TypeSignature.Value: Public NotInheritable Class DisplayCutout Inherits Object
public ref class DisplayCutout sealed : Java::Lang::Object
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DisplayCutout extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the area of the display that is not functional for displaying content.

remarks.para: Represents the area of the display that is not functional for displaying content.
DisplayCutout is immutable.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Android.Graphics.Rect safeInsets, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Graphics.Rect> boundingRects) cil managed

Docs.param: the insets from each edge which avoid the display cutout as returned by #getSafeInsetTop() etc.
the bounding rects of the display cutouts as returned by #getBoundingRects() ()}.

remarks.para: Creates a DisplayCutout instance.
Note that this is only useful for tests. For production code, developers should always use a DisplayCutout obtained from the system.
This member is deprecated. Use DisplayCutout#DisplayCutout(Insets, Rect, Rect, Rect, Rect) instead.

Docs.param: the insets from each edge which avoid the display cutout as returned by #getSafeInsetTop() etc.
the left bounding rect of the display cutout in pixels. If null is passed, it's treated as an empty rectangle (0,0)-(0,0).

the right bounding rect of the display cutout in pixels. If null is passed, it's treated as an empty rectangle (0,0)-(0,0).
the bottom bounding rect of the display cutout in pixels. If null is passed, it's treated as an empty rectangle (0,0)-(0,0).

Note that this is only useful for tests. For production code, developers should always use a DisplayCutout obtained from the system.

Docs.summary: Returns a bounding rectangle for a non-functional area on the display which is located on the bottom of the screen.
Docs.value: bounding rectangle in pixels. In case of no bounding rectangle, an empty rectangle is returned.

remarks.para: Returns a bounding rectangle for a non-functional area on the display which is located on the bottom of the screen.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BoundingRects As IList(Of Rect)

Docs.summary: Returns a list of Rects, each of which is the bounding rectangle for a non-functional area on the display.
Docs.value: a list of bounding Rects, one for each display cutout area. No empty Rect is returned.

remarks.para:
Returns a list of Rects, each of which is the bounding rectangle for a non-functional area on the display.
There will be at most one non-functional area per edge of the device.
Note that there is no bounding rectangle for waterfall cutout since it just represents the curved areas of the display but not the non-functional areas.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CutoutPath As Path
public: property Android::Graphics::Path ^ CutoutPath { Android::Graphics::Path ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Path that contains the cutout paths of all sides on the display.
Docs.value: a Path contains all the cutout paths based on display coordinate. Returns null if there is no cutout on the display.

remarks.para:
Returns a Path that contains the cutout paths of all sides on the display.
To get a cutout path for one specific side, apps can intersect the Path with the Rect obtained from #getBoundingRectLeft(), #getBoundingRectTop(), #getBoundingRectRight() or #getBoundingRectBottom().
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Public ReadOnly Property WaterfallInsets As Insets
public: property Android::Graphics::Insets ^ WaterfallInsets { Android::Graphics::Insets ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the insets representing the curved areas of a waterfall display.
Docs.value: the insets for the curved areas of a waterfall display in pixels or Insets.NONE if there are no curved areas or they don't overlap with the window.

remarks.para: Returns the insets representing the curved areas of a waterfall display.

A waterfall display has curved areas along the edges of the screen. Apps should be careful when showing UI and handling touch input in those insets because the curve may impair legibility and can frequently lead to unintended touch inputs.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
